Taxon name.Name: Rhodococcus erythropolis
Taxon name.Synonymy:
Current name: Rhodococcus erythropolis (Gray and Thornton 1928) Goodfellow and Alderson 1979 (Approved Lists 1980) emend. Nouioui et al. 2018 MB# 
Taxonomic synonyms: 
   - Arthrobacter picolinophilus Tate and Ensign 1974 (Approved Lists 1980) ? MB# 
   - Nocardia calcarea Metcalfe and Brown 1957 (Approved Lists 1980) ? MB#

Nagoya protocol restrictions and complia: documents providing proof of legal access and terms of use available at the collection
Isolator: Water, Kama reservoir, Perm region, Russia
Applications: Uses acrylamide, acrylonitrile, acrylic acid, normal hydrocarbons, aliphatic alcohols (ethanol, heptan-1-ol, propan-1-ol) and aromatic hydrocarbons (oxybenzene) as a sole carbon source; produces biosurfactants when growing on n-alkanes (C10-C17); accumulates molybdenum and nickel; resistant to Cr6+ (15.0 mM), Pb2+ (5.0 mM), VO2+ (12.5 mM), VO43- (50.0 mM), VO3- (>250.0 mM).
